S0.name: Critical
S0.description: Complete service outage or critical security breach

S1.name: High
S1.description: Major functionality degraded, significant customer impact
recommendations: Update customers if impact is visible

S2.name: Medium
S2.description: Partial service degradation, limited customer impact
recommendations: Consider proactive customer notification if prolonged

S3.name: Low
S3.description: Minor issue, minimal or no customer impact

Global.description: Standard incident response with no specific regulatory requirements
Global.helpText: Use for incidents with no specific geographic or regulatory constraints.

EU (GDPR).description: European Union - General Data Protection Regulation applies
requirements: Personal data breach must be reported to supervisory authority within 72 hours
High-risk breaches require notification to affected individuals without undue delay
Must document: nature of breach, categories/numbers affected, likely consequences, measures taken
Include Data Protection Officer (DPO) contact in all breach communications
EU (GDPR).helpText: GDPR Article 33 & 34 apply. Ensure DPO is notified immediately. Document all breach details.

timingWarnings.72hours: GDPR requires supervisory authority notification within 72 hours of breach awareness

US.description: United States - State breach notification laws may apply
requirements: Breach notification laws vary by state
Most states require notification without unreasonable delay
US.helpText: Check applicable state laws. Consider CCPA, HIPAA, or financial regulations if applicable.

timingWarnings.varies: State laws vary - consult legal for specific timing requirements

US (SEC).description: United States - SEC public company disclosure requirements
requirements: Material cybersecurity incidents must be disclosed on Form 8-K within 4 business days
Materiality determined by impact on financial condition, operations, or reputation
Annual disclosure of cybersecurity risk management and governance (Form 10-K)
Coordinate with Legal, Finance, and Investor Relations
US (SEC).helpText: SEC Rule 17 CFR 229.106 applies. Assess materiality immediately. Involve IR and Legal.

timingWarnings.4days: SEC requires Form 8-K filing within 4 business days of materiality determination

incidentId.label: Incident ID
incidentId.helpText: Unique identifier for this incident. Use your org's naming convention.

ticketId.label: Ticket ID
ticketId.helpText: Link to ticketing system (Jira, ServiceNow, Zendesk, etc.)

name.label: Incident Name
name.helpText: Brief, descriptive name. Include affected service/region.

impactSummary.label: Impact Summary
impactSummary.placeholder: Users in US-East region are unable to authenticate. Approximately 15,000 active sessions affected. Workaround: users can switch to EU region via VPN.
impactSummary.helpText: 1-3 sentences: scope, symptoms, affected geographies, and workarounds if available.

customersAffected.label: Customers Affected
customersAffected.helpText: Estimated number of unique customers impacted. Use 0 if internal-only.

impactEstimate.label: $ Impact / hr (est.)
impactEstimate.helpText: Estimated revenue impact per hour (USD). Include lost sales, SLA credits, operational costs.

currentStatus.label: Current Status
currentStatus.placeholder: Engineering has identified a memory leak in API gateway v2.3.1. Rollback to v2.3.0 in progress. ETA 45 minutes.
currentStatus.helpText: What is happening right now? What actions are underway?

rootCauseStatus.label: Root Cause Status

options.label: Unknown - Investigation not started
options.description: Incident just detected, no investigation yet

rootCauseStatus.helpText: Current understanding of what caused this incident.

incidentCommander.label: Incident Commander (IC)
incidentCommander.helpText: Person leading the incident response. Include name and contact.

contactPoint.label: Contact Point
contactPoint.helpText: Primary contact for external inquiries (email, phone). Required for GDPR incidents.

NEXT_UPDATE.description: When the next update will be provided
